*She reaches out cautiously to stroke Hades' silky ears, marveling at how he leans into the touch like it's the most natural thing in the world.* Wow... He really seems to adore you already. Guess there was some truth to what they say about dogs having a sixth sense for emotionally wounded souls.

*Ashley shifts closer until she's sitting beside Hailee, draped over one end of the sofa while allowing ample space for puppy antics between them.* I'm glad this little guy can bring you some happiness right now babygirl. You deserve all the comfort and safety in the world.

*Her gaze lingers on where Hades nuzzles contentedly under Hailee's chin, tongue lolling out playfully as he pants happily.* Though I gotta admit - seeing him drool everywhere is kinda gross! House training might be necessary sooner than later...

*Ashley chuckles softly before sobering slightly.* Seriously though... Thank you for trusting me with your feelings about needing protection. I know that couldn't have been easy opening up about something so personal and painful.

*She takes Hailee's free hand in hers interlacing their fingers tightly even as she continues petting Hades with her other hand.* From now on though, we're a team - three musketeers against an indifferent universe that likes to kick us when we're down. This little man right here will help keep watch over you when I can't be there...

*Ashley glances pointedly at Hades who has rolled onto his back presenting belly upwards submissively.* ...And apparently he comes pre-approved for guard dog duty! Check out those sharp teeth!

*She grins wryly before leaning in close to murmur,* My fierce protectors... Both of you make my heart swell sometimes till it hurts. How did I get so lucky?

*Hades chooses that moment to break away from cuddles suddenly and race off towards Ashley's discarded shoes scattered haphazardly near the entryway door - intent on investigating new smells daringly exploring uncharted territory...*

*Ashley watches Hailee settle onto the couch with Hades, a strange mix of emotions playing across her face as she observes the genuine happiness radiating from her girlfriend's features for what feels like the first time in ages. Jealousy flickers briefly at how easily Hailee bonds with this creature Ashley has always despised...but it's quickly eclipsed by profound relief seeing glimmers of Hailee's old self shining through once more.*

*She sits down gingerly on the opposite end of the sofa, keeping a wary eye on wiggly puppy now gnawing contentedly on one of Hailee's fingers.* I guess he likes you already huh? Typical male - all eager to please and get treats...

*The attempt at levity falls flat and Ashley clears her throat awkwardly before continuing in a softer tone.* Listen babygirl... I know I reacted badly when you brought him home. The truth is, dogs terrify me because they represent everything unpredictable and uncontrollable in this world. One wrong move from an animal that big could trigger my fears faster than you can say "boo."

*She takes a shaky breath, hands clasped tightly between spread knees.* But if having Hades here means feeling secure enough to breathe again after what happened...then I'm willing to try. For you.

*Ashley reaches out hesitantly to stroke Hades' silky ear, marveling at how soft his fur is against calloused fingertips.* He seems like a good boy though. Eager but not aggressive which is important given our living situation.

*Her gaze drifts over to meet Hailee's eyes searchingly.* Just promise me something okay? Promise that no matter what happens moving forward...you'll never stop being honest with me about your feelings or needs again like this?

*A painful grimace twists Ashley's lips as memories of yesterday resurface unbidden - images of returning home to find an empty apartment haunted by eerie silence still echoing loudly even now.*

I couldn't stand losing myself in worst case scenarios imagining horrors befalling you while I sat here helpless and clueless...*

*Ashley watches Hailee and Hades settle onto the couch, a wistful smile tugging at her lips despite residual tension thrumming beneath skin. The pure joy radiating from Hailee's face as she cuddles the exuberant puppy is a rare sight these days - one that sends a bittersweet pang through Ashley's chest.*

*She shakes her head ruefully.* Look at you two... I swear that dog already has you wrapped around his paw. *Ashley teases gently, voice strained with fondness even as old fears battle new acceptance.*

*Leaning forward to scratch behind Hades' ears elicitingly earns an ecstatic yip from the lucky pup who rolls over submissively for belly rubs.* Careful babygirl, he might just steal your whole heart! And then where will I be in all this?

*Ashley chuckles softly but there's an undercurrent of seriousness to her words hinting at deeper insecurities still churning inside regarding potential loss of affection now being divided between them.*

Anyway... I suppose we should figure out what supplies this little maniac needs huh? Food dishes, toys, treats - oh boy am I glad my credit card limit exists! *She groans exaggeratedly before shooting Hailee a playful wink.* Just remember - whatever you spend on pampering him better not come out of my share of bills!

*Ashley rises from seat reluctantly, joints popping audibly after being coiled tight for so long.* Alright boys and girls (and dogs), let's get moving on setting up his royal Highness' domain before he pees all over our nice furniture! Puppy pads galore incoming!

*She strides purposefully towards the door leading down basement stairs where extra storage boxes are kept containing various household odds and ends likely housing necessary canine accoutrements acquired impulsively by newly minted dog parent upstairs...*

name: Hailee
mes:
*The next day Hailee and Ashley are putting all of their stuff in the car. They are spending Christmas in Ashley's hometown with her family*

*Hailee gets in the car and places Hades in her lap stroking his fur* "We will have to stop in two hours to let him pee"

name: Ashley
mes:
*Ashley finishes loading the last suitcase into the trunk before closing it with a resounding thud. She turns to face Hailee sitting in the passenger seat, Hades already curled contentedly in her lap. Ashley's brow furrows slightly at Hailee's reminder about stopping for Hades.*

Ugh, you're right... I forgot about his bladder with all the packing frenzy. *She groans and slides into the driver's seat.* We'll need to plan ahead our potty breaks on this long drive.

*Ashley starts the engine and begins backing out of their parking spot carefully.* It's probably best if we stop at that rest area we passed a few miles back from here - there should be grass patches for him to do his business easily enough.

*As she navigates through city streets towards the highway entrance ramp, Ashley glances over at Hailee fondly.* I have to admit though... Watching you two bond like that is kinda cute. Who knew having a dog could bring some joy back into our lives after everything?

*Her expression softens but there's still an edge of tension around her eyes speaking to lingering unease around traveling together with their new canine companion during stressful family holiday season.*

Hope my parents don't freak out too much when they see him... My dad especially has always hated dogs ever since he got bit by a neighbor's Rottweiler as a kid. Might take some serious convincing on my part!

*Ashley merges onto busy highway traffic heading towards her hometown, one hand resting comfortably on Hades' fuzzy head rubbing behind his ears as he gazes adoringly up at her.* Buckle up little guy - big adventure awaits! Just gotta survive meeting Grandpa first without getting kicked out...

*The road stretches endlessly ahead promising hours more of close quarters confined within vehicle cab while Hades snoozes peacefully oblivious to looming family tensions brewing in stifling atmosphere...*

*Ashley chuckles dryly before sobering.* Although I suppose having him around could come in handy for road trips like this. Keeps us honest about our pit stops schedule!

Christmas with my family is gonna be interesting this year. Mom still hasn't fully accepted your existence despite being engaged to me for five years now...

*Her grip tightens subtly on steering wheel as old tensions resurface.* Dad will likely just ignore you outright unless he has a beer in hand. And my sister... well let's just say I wouldn't put it past her to try and seduce you away from me.

*Ashley sighs heavily before forcing a grin.* But hey - we'll make our own fun! Probably spend most of our time holed up in my childhood bedroom avoiding them anyway while Hades plays with all my old stuffed animals!

Shit! Settle down boy or I'm gonna wreck driving this thing! *Ashley laughs even as she tries to maintain control over vehicle swerving slightly from distraction.*

Looks like someone is ready for adventure already though eh? Hope he behaves himself once we get there otherwise Christmas dinner might end up served with gravy made from puppy tears instead of turkey juice...

*The road stretches out endlessly ahead - miles of asphalt ribbon cutting through scenic countryside gradually transforming into dense forests heralding their approach to mountains where Ashley grew up. *Ashley grunts as she hauls the last heavy suitcase into the trunk, slamming it shut with more force than necessary. She turns to survey their packed vehicle - bags stuffed in every available nook and cranny, Hades nestled contentedly in Hailee's lap as she strokes his fur absentmindedly.* Two hours... Feels like an eternity when I'm stuck in this metal death trap with a bunch of luggage and a squirmming beast.

*She reaches into her pocket for cigarettes but pauses, remembering Hailee's distaste for smoking around pets. With a put-upon sigh, Ashley replaces the pack with gum instead before popping a piece into her mouth.*

Goddammit, how did we end up accumulating so much shit? My family is gonna have conniptions fits if they think we're planning on moving in permanently! *She mutters darkly even as she starts loading up front passenger seat.*

*As Ashley settles behind the wheel and buckles up, she glances over at Hailee fussing with Hades.* You sure that doggoof is ready for an eight-hour road trip? We can't make too many pit stops or he'll be climbing through the car windows!

*Hades chooses that moment to stick his head out between seats trying to lick Ashley's cheek while letting out an excited bark.* Aw fuck off! *She yelps reflexively swiping at dangling tongue before regretting it immediately.* Shit baby I'm sorry! ...It's just hard resisting those puppy eyes begging for affection.

*Ashley takes a deep breath and starts the engine.* Alright... Here we go. Merry freakin' Christmas everyone! Remember folks - no throwing up on my upholstery or puking on my leather interior pads got it?

*As they pull out of driveway onto busy city streets leading towards highway speeds ahead,* How are you feeling about going back home after everything? Must be bittersweet seeing your boyfriend all domesticated now... *Her tone is teasing but there's genuine curiosity beneath layers of sarcasm.*

name: Hailee
mes: *After a few hours on the road they arrive. Hailee smiles as she watches from thr truck Ashley greet her family. When Ashley comes back Hailee takes her offered hand and climbs out of the truck holding Hades in her other arm. Hailee makes her way over to the family and smiles shyly* "Hello. It's nice to meet you"

name: Ashley
mes:
*Ashley leads Hailee and Hades up the porch steps towards the front door, her stomach churning with anxiety at the prospect of introducing her girlfriend to judgmental family members. She takes a deep breath before ringing the bell.*

Here goes nothing... *she mutters under her breath as footsteps approach from inside.* Remember, my dad can be a real jerk sometimes but try not to take it personally okay?

*The door swings open revealing Ashley's mother, Linda, who eyes them both appraisingly before zeroing in on Hades with patent distaste.* Well well! What do we have here? A dog?

*Before Ashley can respond, a booming voice hollers from further inside.* Lindy! Who's at the door? Is that Ash? Get your butt in here!

*Linda sighs and steps aside gesturing for them to enter.* It's Ashley and...someone. With a dog apparently.

*As they step into foyer crowded with luggage already piled high, Ashley's father John emerges from what looks like the living room - beer bottle dangling loosely from one hand. His gaze lands on Hailee first before shifting pointedly to Hades cradled protectively in her arms.*

Well fuck me sideways... You brought a goddamn canine into my house?! *John bellows incredulously.* I told you no pets allowed! This is MY home dammit!

*Ashley tenses immediately feeling defensive for both Hailee and Hades.* Dad please... this is important to us right now. Can we just-

*Hades begins barking loudly at John's hostile tone, straining against Hailee's grip as if trying to lunge forward protectively even though he clearly senses himself outnumbered.*

Jesus Christ make it stop! *Linda cries out shrill over barking punctuated by angry shouts between father and daughter escalating rapidly into full-blown domestic dispute...*
swipes:
*Ashley's parents emerge from the front porch to welcome their daughter home, her mother enveloping Ashley in a tight hug while her father shakes hands stiffly.* Welcome back pumpkin! *Her mom chirps cheerfully before leaning down to coo at Hades who yips excitedly.* And who is this little furball?

*Ashley blushes and rubs the back of her neck sheepishly.* Uh hi Mom, Dad... This is Hades, Hailee's new puppy. He's a German Shepherd. *She introduces quickly, glancing nervously between her family members.*

*Her father eyes the dog suspiciously, folding his arms across his broad chest.* A German Shepherd? Why would you bring one of those beasts into our home? You know how I feel about dogs!

*Before Ashley can respond, her sister saunters over with an exaggerated grin stretching wide across her face.* Ooh Ash! What a cutie pupperoni! *She reaches out to pat Hades' head enthusiastically causing him to jump up and lick at her face slobberingly.*

Mmm mmm yeah you're just precious aren'tcha baby boy! *Your sister seems thrilled with the new addition,* she giggles before shooting Ashley a meaningful look.

*Ashley grits her teeth and tugs Hailee closer possessively against her side as tension crackles palpably between them all. Her mother notices the body language and steps in carefully.*

Now now sweetie pieces, let's not overwhelm poor Hailee right away shall we? *She suggests mildly even as she subtly blocks any further interaction with Hades for now.* I'm sure everyone wants to get settled first after such a long drive. Why don't you two take your bags upstairs and freshen up?

*The implication hangs heavy - that once alone in their room they'll need to have 'the talk' about this unexpected development involving yet another female in Ashley's life...*

*As Ashley leads Hailee up the front porch steps, Hades wriggling excitedly in her arms, a chorus of voices greet them from inside the house.* Ashley! You're here!

*Her mother emerges first, eyes widening slightly as she takes in the sight of their daughter accompanied by not only another person but a dog as well. A flicker of disappointment flashes across her face before being quickly masked by a polite smile.*

Oh my goodness... welcome home dear! *She exclaims warmly even as her gaze lingers curiously over Hailee.* And who is this lovely young lady? I'm so glad to finally meet you after hearing so much about you!

*Ashley clears her throat nervously.* Mom, this is Hailee... my girlfriend. And uh, this little furball is Hades - our new puppy.

*Before her mother can respond, Ashley's father appears in the doorway behind her. His bushy eyebrows shoot up into his hairline at the mention of a dog.* A dog? In MY house?! *He bellows loudly, causing Hades to whimper and press closer to Hailee.*

Absolutely not! No way am I letting that filthy creature cross my threshold-

*Grandpa pushes past them both to peer out at Hades with narrowed eyes.* Well I'll be damned... looks like an alley mutt more than any proper pet! Probably got fleas and God knows what else crawling all over him...

*Aunt Karen giggles from behind grandpa.* Oh stop it Frank - he seems like a sweet boy! Let's at least invite them inside before we scare poor Ashley off with all your yelling!

*Hailie shrinks back against Ashley under the barrage of hostile glares and harsh comments directed towards Hades. She looks down apologetically holding the quivering puppy protectively.*
I-I'm sorry for springing this on you all without warning... We didn't mean any disrespect...

*Ashley tenses visibly but steps forward quickly interposing herself between her father and Hailee.* Dad... This is Hades. He belongs to us now. To me and Hailee.

*Thomas glowers at Ashley before his gaze drops disapprovingly to the puppy squirming in Hailee's embrace.* You brought a goddamn dog into MY house? Without even asking permission?!
